CM-101.topic: Perceive the need for improving communication in English for employability
Use adjectives and articles effectively while speaking and in writing
Write simple sentences
Develop positive self-esteem for harmonious relationships
Use affixation to form new words
Use prepositions and use a few phrasal verbs contextually
Use social media with discretion
Speak about abilities and possibilities
Make requests and express obligations
Use modal verbs and main verbs in appropriate form
Write short dialogues about everyday situations
Realize the importance of humour for a healthy living
Improve vocabulary related to the theme
Inculcate reading and speaking skills
Frame sentences with proper Subject – Verb agreement
Understand the features of a good paragraph and learn how to gather ideas as a preliminary step for writing a good paragraph.
Learn to deal with failures in life
Use the present tense form for various every day communicative functions
Write paragraphs with coherence and other necessary skills
Understand the ecological challenges that we face today and act to save the environment.
Narrate / Report past events and talk about future actions
Develop vocabulary related to environment
Write e-mails
Appraise and value other cultures for a happy living in multi-cultural workspace
Understand the usage of different types of sentences
Ask for or give directions, information, instructions
Use language to express emotions in various situations
Write letters in various real life situations
Understand the functional difference between Active Voice and Passive Voice
Use Passive Voice to speak and write in various contexts
Understand the major parts and salient features of an essay
Learn about latest innovations and get motivated
Understand the importance of setting goals in life
Report about what others have said both in speaking and writing
Write an essay following the structure in a cohesive and comprehensive manner
Apply the words related to Goal Setting in conversations and in life
Value the other genders and develop a gender-balanced view towards life
Identify the use of different conjunctions in synthesising sentences
Write various types of sentences to compare and contrast the ideas
Apply the knowledge of sentence synthesis in revising and rewriting short essays
Develop discourses in speech and writing
be aware of different kinds of disasters and the concept of disaster management
Generate vocabulary relevant to disaster management and use it in sentences
Analyze an error in a sentence and correct it
Learn and write different kinds of reports

CM-102.topic: Define Set, Ordered pair and Cartesian product of two sets - examples. Explain Relations and Functions - examples. Find Domain & Range of functions - simple examples.
Define one-one and onto functions. Find the inverse of a function - simple examples.

Define rational, proper and improper fractions of polynomials. Explain the procedure of resolving proper fractions of the types mentioned below into partial fractions: i) f(x)/((ax+b)(cx+d)), ii) f(x)/((ax+b)^2(cx+d))
Define a matrix and order of a matrix. State various types of matrices with examples (emphasis on 3rd order square matrices).
Compute sum, difference, scalar multiplication and product of matrices.
Define the transpose of a matrix and state its properties - examples.
Define symmetric and skew-symmetric matrices with examples.
Define determinant of a square matrix; minor, co-factor of an element of a 3x3 square matrix with examples. Expand the determinant of a 3 x 3 matrix.
Distinguish singular and non-singular matrices. Define multiplicative inverse of a matrix. Compute adjoint and multiplicative inverse of a square matrix.
Solve a system of 3 linear equations in 3 unknowns using Cramer's rule and matrix inversion method.
Define trigonometric ratios of any angle - List the values of trigonometric ratios at specified values. Draw graphs of trigonometric functions.
Define compound angles and state the formulae of sin(A±B), cos(A±B), tan(A±B) and cot(A±B).
Give simple examples on compound angles to derive the values of sin15, cos15, sin75, cos75, tan15, tan75 etc.
Derive identities like sin(A+B) sin(A-B) = sin^2 A –sin^2 B etc. Solve simple problems on compound angles.
Derive the formulae of multiple angles 2A, 3A etc and sub multiple angle A/2 in terms of angle A.
Derive useful allied formulae like sin^2 A = (1- cos2A)/2 etc. Solve simple problems using these formulae.
Derive the formulae on transforming sum or difference of two trigonometric ratios in to a product and vice versa. Solve problems.
Define inverses of six trigonometric functions along with their domains and ranges. Derive relations between inverse trigonometric functions.
State various properties of inverse trigonometric functions and identities. Apply formulae to solve Simple problems.
Explain solution of trigonometric equations and find the general solutions of sin x=k, cos x =k and tan x=k.
Solve models of the type a sin^2 x + b sin x +c=0 and a sin x + b cos x=c.
State sine rule, cosine rule, tangent rule and projection rule and solve a triangle.
List various formulae for the area of a triangle with examples.
Define a complex number, its modulus, conjugate, amplitude and list their properties. Define arithmetic operations on complex numbers.
Represent the complex number in various forms like modulus-amplitude (polar) form, Exponential (Euler) form.
Write different forms of a straight line – general form, point-slope form, slope-intercept form, two-point form, intercept form and normal form.
Find distance of a point from a line, acute angle between two lines, intersection of two non-parallel lines and distance between two parallel lines.
Define locus of a point and circle. Write the general equation of a circle and find its centre and radius.
Find the equation of a circle, given (i) centre and radius, (ii) two ends of the diameter (iii) three non collinear points of type (0,0) (a,0), (0, b).
Define a conic section - Explain the terms focus, directrix, eccentricity, axes and latus-rectum of a conic.
Find the equation of a conic when focus, directrix and eccentricity are given.
Explain the concept of limit and meaning of lim(x->a)f(x)=l and state the properties of limits.
Evaluate the limits of the type lim(x->a)f(x)/g(x) and lim(x->inf)f(x)/g(x).
State the Standard limits (without proof) and solve simple problems.
Explain the concept of continuity of a function at a point and on an interval.
State the concept of derivative of a function y = f(x) – definition, first principle. Explain the significance of derivative in scientific and engineering applications.
Find the derivative of standard algebraic, logarithmic, exponential and trigonometric functions using the first principle.
Find the derivatives of inverse trigonometric, hyperbolic and inverse hyperbolic functions.
State the rules of differentiation of sum, difference, scalar multiplication, product and quotient of functions.
Explain the method of differentiation of a function of a function (Chain rule).
Explain the method of differentiation of parametric functions.
Explain the procedure for finding the derivatives of implicit functions.
Explain the need of taking logarithms for differentiating some functions of [f(x)]^g(x) type.
Explain the concept of finding the second order derivatives.
Explain the concept of functions of several variables, finding partial derivatives.
Explain the concept of finding second order partial derivatives.
State the geometrical meaning of the derivative. Explain the concept of derivative to find the slopes of tangent and normal.
Find the equations of tangent and normal to to a given curve at any point on it – simple problems.
Explain the derivative as a rate of change in distance-time relations to find the velocity and acceleration.
Explain the derivative as a rate measurer in the problems where the quantities like areas, volumes vary with respect to time.
Define the concept of increasing and decreasing functions. Explain the conditions to find points.
Explain the procedure to find the extreme values (maxima or minima) of a function of single variable.

CM-103.topic: Explain the concept of units. Define Physical quantity, Fundamental quantities, Derived quantities.
Define unit, fundamental units, derived units. State SI units with symbols for fundamental and some derived quantities.
State Multiples and Submultiples in SI system. State rules of writing S.I units. State advantages of SI units.
What are direct and indirect measurements. Define accuracy and least count.
Define error in measurement. Define absolute, relative and percentage errors with their formulae.
Solve simple problems on absolute, relative and percentage errors.
Explain the concept of Vectors. Define scalar and vector quantities with examples. Represent vectors geometrically.
Define the types of vectors (equal, negative, unit, co-initial, co-planar, position vector). Resolve the vector into rectangular components.
State and explain triangle law of addition of vectors. Define concurrent forces, co-planar forces and equilibrant.
State and explain Lami's theorem. State the parallelogram law of addition of forces with diagram.
Write the expressions for magnitude and direction of resultant (no derivation). Illustrate parallelogram law with examples.
Define moment of force and couple. Write the formulae and S.I units.
Solve simple problems on (i)Resolution of force and (ii) Parallelogram law of forces.
State and explain Newton's universal law of gravitation. Define G and mention its value.
Explain the acceleration due to gravity (g). Explain the factors affecting the value of g.
Derive the relationship between g and G.
State and explain the Kepler's laws of planetary motion.
Define a satellite. What are natural and artificial satellites? Give examples.
Define orbital velocity and write its formula. Define escape velocity and write its formula.
Write a brief note on Polar satellites. Write a brief note on Geo-stationary satellites.
Mention the applications of artificial satellites.
Solve simple problems on (i) Newton's law of gravitation and (ii) calculation of orbital and escape velocities.
Define work done and energy. Mention their SI units. List various types of energy.
Define P.E with examples. Write its equation. Define K.E with examples. Write its equation.
Derive relationship between K.E and momentum.
State the law of conservation of energy. Give various examples.
Write a brief note on solar energy. Explain the principle of solar thermal conversion.
Explain the principle of photo voltaic effect.
Solve simple problems on (i) work done (ii) P.E & K.E and (iii) Relation between K.E & momentum.
Define the concepts of heat and temperature. State different modes of transmission of heat.
Explain conduction, convection and radiation with two examples each.
State and explain Boyle's law. Define absolute zero temperature. Explain absolute scale of temperature.
State the relationship between degree Celsius, Kelvin and Fahrenheit temperatures.
State Charle's law and write its equation. State Gay-Lussac's law and write its equation.
Define ideal gas. Derive ideal gas equation.
Explain why universal gas constant (R) is same for all gases. Calculate the value of R for 1 gram mole of gas.
Solve simple problems on (i) Inter conversion of temperatures (ii) Gas laws and (iii) Ideal gas equation.
Define the term sound. Define longitudinal and transverse waves with one example each.
Explain the factors which affect the velocity of sound in air. Distinguish between musical sound and noise.
Explain noise pollution and state SI unit for intensity of sound.
Explain sources of noise pollution. Explain effects of noise pollution. Explain methods of minimizing noise pollution.
Define Doppler effect. List the Applications of Doppler effect.
Define reverberation and reverberation time. Write Sabine's formula and name the physical quantities in it.
Define echoes and explain the condition to hear an echo. Mention the methods of reducing an echo.
Mention the applications of an echo. What are ultrasonics? Mention the applications of ultra sonics, SONAR.
Solve simple problems on echo.
Explain the concept of P.D and EMF. State Ohm's law and write the formula. Explain Ohm's law.
Define resistance and specific resistance. Write their S.I units.
State and explain Kichoff's first law. State and explain Kirchoff's second law.
Describe Wheatstone bridge with legible sketch. Derive an expression for balancing condition of Wheatstone bridge.
Describe Meter Bridge experiment with necessary circuit diagram. Write the formulae to find resistance and specific resistance.
Explain the concept of magnetism. What are natural and artificial magnets.
Define magnetic field and magnetic lines of force. Write the properties of magnetic lines of force.
State and explain the Coulomb's inverse square law of magnetism. Define magnetic permeability.
Define para, dia, ferro magnetic materials with examples.
Solve simple problems on (i) Ohm's law (ii) Kirchoff's first law (iii) Wheatstone bridge (iv) meter bridge and (v) Coulomb's inverse square law.
State and explain Photo-electric effect. Write Einstein's Photo electric equation.
State laws of photo electric effect. Explain the Working of photo electric cell. List the Applications.
Recapitulate refraction of light and its laws. Define critical angle. Explain the Total Internal Reflection.
Explain the principle and working of Optical Fiber. List the applications of Optical Fiber.
Explain the energy gap based on band structure. Distinguish between conductors, semiconductors and insulators.
Define doping. Explain the concept of hole. Explain the types of semiconductors: Intrinsic and extrinsic.
Explain n-type and p-type semiconductors. Mention the applications of semiconductors.
Define superconductor and superconductivity. List the applications of superconductors.
Nanotechnology definition, nano materials and applications.

CM-104.topic: Explain the charge, mass of fundamental particles of an atom (electron, proton and neutron) and the concept of atomic number and mass number.
State the Postulates of Bohr’s atomic theory and its limitations.
Explain the significance of four Quantum numbers and draw the atomic structures of Silicon and Germanium.
Define Orbital of an atom and draw the shapes of s, p and d-orbitals.
Explain 1. Aufbau principle, 2. Pauli’s exclusion principle 3. Hund’s principle.
Write the electronic configuration of elements up to atomic number 30.
Explain the significance of chemical bonding. Explain the Postulates of Electronic theory of valency.
Define and explain Ionic and Covalent bonds with examples of NaCl, H2, O2 and N2 (Lewis dot method).
List out the Properties of Ionic compounds and covalent compounds and distinguish between their properties.
Define the terms Solution, Solute and Solvent. Classify solutions based on solubility.
Define Atomic weight, Molecular weight and Equivalent weight. Calculate Molecular weight and Equivalent weight of given acids, bases and salts.
Define mole and solve numerical problems on mole concept.
Define molarity, normality and solve numerical problems on molarity and normality.
Calculate Molarity or Normality given weight/volume. Calculate weight of solute given Molarity/Normality and volume.
Problems on dilution to convert high concentrated solutions to low concentrated solutions.
Explain Arrhenius theory of Acids and Bases and give its limitations.
Define ionic product of water, pH and solve numerical problems on pH (Strong Acids and Bases).
Define buffer solution and classify buffer solutions with examples. Give its applications.
Define Conductor, Semiconductor, Insulator, Electrolyte, Non-electrolyte. Distinguish between Metallic and Electrolytic conduction.
Explain electrolysis by taking an example of fused NaCl and list out the applications of electrolysis.
Define Galvanic cell. Explain the construction and working of Galvanic cell. Distinguish between electrolytic cell and galvanic cell.
Define battery and list the types of batteries with examples.
Explain the construction, working and applications of Dry cell (Leclanche cell), Lead storage battery, Lithium-Ion battery and Hydrogen-Oxygen fuel cell.
Define the term corrosion. State the Factors influencing the rate of corrosion.
Describe the formation of composition cell, stress cell, and concentration cell during corrosion.
Define rusting of iron and explain the mechanism of rusting of iron.
Explain the methods of prevention of corrosion by Protective coatings (anodic and cathodic coatings).
Explain prevention of corrosion by Cathodic protection (Sacrificial anode process and Impressed-voltage process).
Define soft water and hard water. Define and classify the hardness of water. List salts causing hardness.
State the disadvantages of using hard water in industries. Define Degree of hardness and units (mg/L and ppm).
Solve numerical problems on hardness.
Explain the methods of softening of hard water by Ion-exchange process and Reverse Osmosis process.
Explain the concept of polymerization. Describe addition polymerization of ethylene and condensation polymerization of Bakelite.
Define plastic. Explain preparation and uses of PVC, Teflon, Polystyrene, Nylon 6,6.
Define elastomers. Explain preparation and applications of Buna-S and Neoprene.
Define an alloy. Write composition and applications of Nichrome, Duralumin, Stainless Steel.
Define Composite Materials, Liquid Crystals, Nano Materials. Give examples, properties and applications for each.
Define the term fuel. Classify the fuels based on occurrence.
Write the composition and uses of LPG, CNG, Biogas, Power alcohol.
Write the commercial production of Hydrogen as future fuel. Give its advantages and disadvantages.
Explain the scope and importance of environmental studies. Define environment and segments (Lithosphere, Hydrosphere, Atmosphere, Biosphere).
Define terms: Pollutant, Pollution, Contaminant, Receptor, Sink, Particulates, DO, TLV, BOD, COD, Eco system, Producers, Consumers, Decomposers.
State renewable and non-renewable energy sources. State uses of forest resources. Explain causes and effects of deforestation.
Define air pollution and explain its Global impacts (Greenhouse effect, Ozone layer depletion, Acid rain).
Define Water pollution. Explain causes, effects and controlling methods. Define e-Pollution, sources of e-waste, health effects and control.
Define Green Chemistry. Write the Principles and benefits of Green Chemistry.

CM-105.topic: Define various terms: Computer, Hardware, Software, Firmware, High Level Language, Low Level Language.
Draw and explain block diagram of a Computer in detail.
Describe the current family of CPUs used in Computers.
State the use of storage devices used in a Computer. List the two types of memory used. State the importance of cache memory.
Explain the generations of computers. Classification of computers based on size and processor.
State the importance of binary number system for use in Digital Computers.
State the steps involved in problem solving. Define algorithm and list its characteristics.
Define program. Differentiate between program and algorithm. State steps in algorithm development.
Differentiate between algorithm and flowchart. Draw symbols used in flowcharts.
Develop algorithms and draw flowcharts for simple problems.
Describe the need for an operating system. List the various operating systems used presently.
List and explain types of DOS commands, Internal Commands, and External Commands.
Features of Windows desktop. Components of a Window and their functions.
Describe starting a program, usage of window buttons (maximize, etc.), and file/folder concepts.
Describe methods of viewing hard disk content and searching for files.
Use control panel for software/hardware installation, changing date/time, and installing a printer.
Explain Drive space, Disk defragmentation, and changing display properties (resolution, color, screensaver).

CM-105.text: UNIT 4: Computer Hardware and Networking Basics

CM-105.topic: Hardware Basics: Identify hardware (I/P, O/P, inside case, system board). Explain 3 types of Software (ROM BIOS, OS, Application).
Explain Functions of BIOS, boot process, POST, beep codes, and different connectors.
Networking Basics: Explain computer network, LAN, WAN. Compare Internet and Intranet. Describe ISP.
Explain the role of a modem. Describe address format and IP address. Explain browsers and search engines. Explain Internet Security.

CM-105.text: UNIT 5: Emerging Trends in Computer Technology

CM-105.topic: Introduction to Machine Learning: Definition, Comparison with Traditional Programming, Applications, Key elements, Terms (Decision tree, Neural networks, Deep learning, etc.), Inductive Learning, Classification.
Introduction to Blockchain Technology: Definition, Importance, Applications, Types, Features, Advantages, Characteristics.
Basics of Ethical Hacking: Definition, Hacker categories, Roles/responsibilities, Phases in Ethical Hacking, Penetrate testing.
Virtual Reality concepts: Terms (VR, Telepresence, Cyberspace, HCI, Haptics, Augmented/Mixed Reality), Evolution of VR.

CM-106.topic: Describe history, structure, and programming style of C language. Explain steps in Editing, compiling, executing and debugging.
Describe character set, C-Tokens, Keywords, Identifiers, Constants, Variables.
Classify Data Types. Explain declaration and initialization of variables/constants. Explain user defined data types and type qualifiers.

CM-106.text: UNIT 2: Input and output statements, Operators and Expressions

CM-106.topic: Explain Pre-processor Directive #include. Illustrate reading/writing characters (getch, putch, etc.) and formatted I/O (scanf, printf).
Define operator and expression. Explain arithmetic, relational, logical, unary, binary, assignment, increment/decrement, conditional, bit-wise and special operators.
Explain Precedence and Associativity. Describe evaluation of compound expressions and type conversion techniques.

CM-106.text: UNIT 3: Decision making, iterative and other control statements

CM-106.topic: Explain decision making statements: Simple if, if-else, Nested if..else, if-else-if ladder, switch statement.
State importance of break statement. Compare conditional operator with if-else and if-else with switch.
Define looping. List and explain iterative statements (while, do..while, for). Compare loops. Explain nested loops.
Explain goto, break, and continue statements. Define structured programming.

CM-106.text: UNIT 4: Arrays, strings, Structures and Unions

CM-106.topic: Define Array. Describe One Dimensional Array (declaration, initialization, access). Explain Two Dimensional Arrays (matrix operations).
Define String. Describe declaration, initialization, I/O of strings. Explain String handling functions and Character arithmetic.
Define structure. Explain declaration, initialization, accessing members, structure assignment, size, nested structures, arrays of structures.
Define Union. Declare, initialize and use union. Distinguish between Structures and Unions.

CM-106.text: UNIT 5: User defined functions, pointers, files, preprocessor

CM-106.topic: Explain User defined functions: Need, advantages, elements, return values, call, prototype. Explain function declaration types and recursion.
Explain passing arrays/structures to functions. Explain Storage classes, Scope, visibility, lifetime. Differentiate Local/Global variables.
Explain Pointers: Declaration, initialization, accessing address/value, arithmetic, precedence. Relationship between arrays and pointers.
Explain Pointers as function arguments, Pointer arrays, Dynamic memory management functions. Pointers to structures/Self referential structures.
Explain Files: declaration, opening modes, closing, I/O operations, random access, file handling functions.
Explain Preprocessor directives (Need, types). Write programs using preprocessor directives and command line arguments.

CM-107.text: UNIT 1: Use of Drawing Instruments, Free Hand Lettering and Dimensioning Practice

CM-107.topic: State the importance of drawing as an engineering communication medium
Select the correct instruments to draw the different lines / curves
Use correct grade of pencil and other instruments to draw different types of lines and for different purposes
Identify the steps to be taken to keep the drawing clean and tidy
Write titles using vertical and slopping (inclined) lettering and numerals of 7mm, 10mm and 14mm height
Acquaint with the conventions, notations, rules and methods of dimensioning in engineering drawing as per the B.I.S
Dimension a given drawing using standard notations and desired system of dimensioning
Practice the basic geometric constructions like dividing a line into equal parts
Exterior and interior tangents to the given two circles
Tangent arcs to two given lines and arcs
Draw any regular polygon using general method when side length is given
Inscribing circle radius is given ii) describing circle radius is given
Draw the engineering curves like i) involute ii) cycloid

CM-107.text: UNIT 3: Projections of points, lines, planes and solids

CM-107.topic: Explain the basic principles of the orthographic projections
Visualise and draw the projection of a point with respect to reference planes (HP & VP)
Visualise and draw the projections of straight lines with respect to two reference Planes
Visualise and draw the projections of planes
Visualise and draw the projections of regular solids like Prisms, Pyramids, Cylinder, Cone
Identify the need to draw sectional views
Draw sectional views of regular solids by applying the principles of hatching
Draw the orthographic views of an object from its pictorial drawing
Draw the minimum number of views needed to represent a given object fully

CM-108.topic: Exercise on structure of C Program
Exercise on input and output of characters
Exercise on formatted input and output
Exercise on conditional operator comparing with if-else statement

CM-108.text: UNIT 4: User defined functions, storage classes, pointers, files, and macros

CM-109.topic: Vernier calipers - determine the volumes of a cylinder and sphere
Micrometer (Screw gauge) - determine thickness of a glass plate and cross sectional area of a wire
Verification of Lami’s theorem using concurrent forces
Determination of g using simple pendulum
Focal length and power of convex lens
Refractive index of solid using travelling microscope
Verification of Boyle’s law using Quill tube
Determination of pole strength of the bar magnet through magnetic field lines
Resonance apparatus – Determination of velocity of sound in air
Meter bridge – Determination of resistance and specific resistance of a wire
Verification of Newton’s law of cooling
Photo electric cell – Study of its characteristics

CM-110.topic: Recognition of chemical substances and solutions used in the laboratory by senses
Preparation of Std.Na2CO3 solution and making solutions of different dilutions
Estimation of HCl solution using Std.Na2CO3 solution
Estimation of NaOH using Std. HCl solution
Determination of acidity of water sample
Determination of alkalinity of water sample
Estimation of Mohr’s Salt using Std.KMnO4 Solution
Estimation of Ferrous ion by using Std. K2Cr2O7 solution
Determination of total hardness of water sample using Std. EDTA solution
Estimation of Chlorides present in water sample by using Std. AgNO3 solution
Estimation of Dissolved Oxygen(D.O) in water sample by using Std. hypo solution
Determination of pH using pH meter
Determination of conductivity of water and adjusting ionic strength required
Estimation of total solids present in water sample

CM-111.topic: Familiarize with Computer system and hardware connections
Start and Shut down Computer correctly
Check the software details of the computer
Check the hardware present in your computer
Explore Windows Desktop
Working with Files and Folders
Windows Accessories: Calculator – Notepad – WordPad – MS Paint
Familiarize with Ribbon layout of MS Word
Practice Word Processing Basics
Practice Formatting techniques
Insert a table of required number of rows and columns
Insert Objects, Clipart and Hyperlinks
Use Mail Merge feature of MS Word
Use Equations and symbols features
Familiarize with MS-EXCEL layout
Access and enter data in the cells
Edit a spread sheet- Copy, Cut, Paste, and selecting Cells
Use built in functions and Formatting Data
Create Excel Functions, Filling Cells
Enter a Formula for automatic calculations
Sort and filter data in table
Present data using Excel Graphs and Charts
Develop lab reports of respective discipline
Format a Worksheet in Excel, Page Setup and Print
Familiarize with Ribbon layout features of PowerPoint 2007
Create a simple PowerPoint Presentation
Set up a Master Slide in PowerPoint
Insert Text and Objects
Insert a Flow Charts, Table, Charts/Graphs
Insert video and audio, Hyperlinks
Practice Animating text and objects
Review presentation
Familiarize with standard toolbox
Edit a photograph
Insert Borders around photograph
Change Background of a Photograph
Change colors of Photograph
Prepare a cover page for the book in your subject area
Adjust the brightness and contrast of the picture
Type a word and apply the shadow emboss effects

CM-301.topic: Explain the concept of Indefinite integral as an anti-derivative and properties of integrals
Evaluate integrals involving simple functions by method of substitution
Find the integrals of tan x, cot x, sec x and cosec x
Evaluate the Standard integrals of inverse trigonometric type functions
Evaluate integrals using decomposition method and integration by parts
Use Bernoulli’s rule for evaluating integrals and integrals of form e^x[f(x) + f'(x)]
State the fundamental theorem of integral calculus and explain Definite integral
Evaluate simple problems on definite integrals using properties
Define a differential equation, its order and degree
Form a differential equation by eliminating arbitrary constants
Solve first order and first degree differential equations by variables separable method
Solve first order linear differential equations of the type dy/dx + Py = Q
Define a graph and explain its terminology (vertices, edges, degree, etc.)
Explain various types of graphs and formation of adjacency matrix
Define basic probability principles, permutations, and combinations
State addition theorem of probability and solve problems
Explain conditional probability, multiplication theorem, and independent events
State Bayes’ theorem and solve simple problems
Recall measures of central tendency and explain measures of dispersion
Find Range, Mean Deviation, and Standard Deviation for ungrouped data
Explain bivariate data, covariance, and correlation
Calculate Pearson’s correlation coefficient and Spearman’s rank correlation coefficient
Explain predictor variables, outcome variables and simple linear regression

CM-302.topic: List and explain various number systems (Decimal, Binary, Octal, Hexadecimal)
Perform conversions between different number bases
Explain Signed and Unsigned binary number representations
Perform Signed binary arithmetic (Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication, Division)
Explain Binary Coded Decimal (BCD) coding schemes (8421, 2421, Excess-3)
Explain Character representation codes (ASCII, EBCDIC)

CM-302.text: UNIT 2: Logic Gates, Boolean Algebra and Basic Combinational Circuits

CM-302.topic: Define Boolean algebra and explain AND, OR, NOT, EX-OR, EX-NOR operations
State and apply De-Morgan’s theorems
Simplify Boolean expressions using K-Map (up to 4 variables)
Explain Basic and Universal Logic Gates with truth tables
Define and explain Half Adder and Full Adder circuits
Explain Parallel Adder and Serial Adder
Explain the operation of a digital comparator
Define Flip flop and differentiate between Latch and Flip-flop
Explain Edge triggering and Level triggering
Explain working of RS, D, JK, and T Flip-flops
Explain the working of a Master-Slave flip-flop
Define Counters and distinguish between synchronous and asynchronous counters
Draw and explain Ripple counters and Synchronous counters
Explain Decade counter, Up/Down counter, and Ring counter
Define Registers and list data transfer methods
Explain Serial-in/Serial-out, Serial-in/Parallel-out, Parallel-in/Serial-out, Parallel-in/Parallel-out registers
Explain Shift left, Shift right, and Universal shift registers
Define and explain Multiplexer and De-multiplexer
Define and explain Encoder and Decoder
Define Programmable Logic Devices and explain Programmable Logic Array (PLA)

CM-303.topic: Define Operating System and discuss its history and types (Multiprogramming, Timesharing, Distributed, Real-time)
Describe OS components, services, and System Calls
Define Single user and Multi user operating system structure
Define Process, Process Control Block, and Process State Diagram
Explain CPU Scheduling, Scheduling queues, and Schedulers
Explain Scheduling Algorithms (FCFS, SJF, Round Robin, Priority, Multilevel)
Define Deadlock and necessary conditions for it
Discuss Deadlock prevention, avoidance, detection, and recovery
Describe address binding, dynamic loading, linking, overlays, and swapping
Explain Partition allocation, Fragmentation, Paging, and Segmentation
Define Virtual memory, Demand paging, and Page replacement algorithms (FIFO, LRU, Optimal)
Explain Thrashing and Working set model

CM-303.text: UNIT 5: Disk Scheduling and File Management

CM-303.topic: List Disk performance parameters and Scheduling policies (FIFO, SSTF, SCAN)
Define File management, operations, access methods, and allocation methods
Explain Directory structure and Disk organization

CM-304.text: UNIT 1: Introduction to Data Structures & Sequential Storage

CM-304.topic: Define Data Structure, classify them (Linear/Non-linear), and explain ADTs
Explain Sorting Techniques: Bubble, Selection, Insertion, Quick, Merge Sort
Explain Searching Techniques: Linear Search and Binary Search
Explain Linked Lists, advantages over Arrays, and Dummy Header
Perform operations (insert, delete, traverse, sort, search) on Singly and Doubly Linked Lists
Explain Singly Circular and Doubly Circular Linked Lists
Define Stack and explain Array/Linked List implementation of Stack operations
List applications of Stacks and perform Infix to Postfix conversion
Define Queue and explain Array/Linked List implementation of Queue operations
Explain Circular Queues and their implementation
List applications of Queues and know about Priority Queues
Define Tree, Binary Tree and explain tree terminology
Explain representations of Binary Trees and Binary Search Trees (BST)

CM-505.text: UNIT 2: Control Flow and Loops (15 Periods)

Various Loop Statements: for Loop, while loop
Loop control statements: break, continue, pass
Introduction to Functions
Function Arguments: Default arguments, Variable Length arguments
Anonymous Functions
Return Statement
Scope of variables
Creation of modules, importing of modules.
Python Variable: Namespace and scoping
Python Packages
Strings: String slices, immutability, String functions and methods, String module.
Python Arrays.
Accessing of elements in an Array, Array methods.
Python Lists: Basic List Operations, List Slices, List methods, List loop, mutability, aliasing, Cloning lists, List parameters, List comprehension.
Tuples: Tuple assignment, Tuple as return value, Tuple Comprehension
Dictionaries: Creation of dictionary/assignment, Operations and methods, Dictionary Comprehension.
Sets.

CM-505.text: UNIT 5: Object Oriented Programming, File Handling and Exception Handling (20 Periods)

CM-505.topic: Object Oriented Programming: Creating Classes, Creating Objects, Method Overloading and Overriding, Data Hiding, Data Abstraction
File Handling: Opening files in different modes, Processing files, Closing a file
Exception Handling: Difference between error and Exception, Handling Exception, try except block, Raising Exceptions, User Defined Exceptions

CM-506.topic: Create an Android Application To display “Hello World”
Create an Android Application To display a Toast Message
Create an Android app to accept a number in text field and display the factorial of it in a Toast message on clicking a button
Create an Android app to illustrate the use of Check Box widget.
Create an Android app to illustrate the use of Spinner (Combo Box)widget.
Create an Android app to illustrate the use of Date picker widget and Time picker widget.
Create an Android app that uses multiple UI controls like Edit Text, Check Box, Spinner and Buttons
Create an Android app to shift from one activity to another activity using a button.
Create an Android Application Using Image Effects
Create an Android Application Using Image Switcher
Create an Android Application Using Alert Dialog
Create an Android Application To Integrate Google Maps
Create an Android Application To send SMS
Create an Android Application To calling a number
Create an Android Application To send E-mail
Create an Android Application Using Database

CM-507.topic: Write and execute simple python Program.
Write /execute simple ‘Python’ program: Develop minimum 2 programs using different data types
Write /execute simple ‘Python’ program: Develop minimum 2 programs using Arithmetic Operators, exhibiting data type conversion.
Write simple programs to convert units (e.g., dollars to rupees, bits to MB/GB/TB).
Write simple programs to calculate geometric properties (e.g., area/perimeter of square, volume/perimeter of cone).
Write program to: (i) determine odd/even. (ii) Find greatest of three numbers.
Write a program to: i) Find factorial. ii) Generate multiplication table.
Write a program to: i) Factorial using recursion. ii) Fibonacci sequence using recursion.
Write a program to: Create a list, add element, delete element.
Write a program to: Sort the list, reverse the list, count elements.
Write a program to: Create dictionary, add element, delete element.
Write a program to: Calculate average, mean, median, standard deviation of numbers in a list.
Write a program to: Print Factors of a given Number.
File I/O: i) Create file and write 'Hello World'. ii) Append 'Hello world'.
File I/O: i) Read file, write to another, replace 'h'. ii) Read file, count occurrences of 'a'.
Program to: Add two complex numbers using classes and objects.
Program to: Subtract two complex numbers using classes and objects.
Program to: Create a package and accessing a package.

CM-508.topic: Goal Setting… life without a goal is a rudderless boat!
Time Management … the need of the hour!
Critical Thinking… Logic is the key!
Problem Solving… there is always a way out!
Team Work… Together we are better!
Leadership… the making of a leader!
Stress Management … live life to the full !!

CM-509.topic: Identify different works to be carried out in the Project
Collect data relevant to the project work, Carryout need survey and identify the problem(project)
Select life cycle, Estimate cost, skills, materials. Prepare plan and schedule.
Prepare SRS document, Design required elements (e.g., UML)
Develop working software modules. Prepare critical activities plan.
Test, Debug, verify, validate. Record results. Prepare project report/user manual.
